name: http_get
description: Make an HTTP GET request to retrieve data from a web server or API endpoint. Use this to fetch web pages, API data, or any publicly accessible HTTP resources.

url.description: The complete HTTP/HTTPS URL to request. Must include protocol (http:// or https://). Examples: 'https://api.example.com/data', 'https://www.example.com/page.html'

http_headers.description: Optional HTTP headers to include with the request. Common headers include Authorization, Content-Type, User-Agent, etc.

name: http_post
description: Make an HTTP POST request to send data to a web server or API endpoint. Use this to submit forms, send API data, or perform actions that modify server state.

url.description: The complete HTTP/HTTPS URL to post to. Must include protocol (http:// or https://). Examples: 'https://api.example.com/submit', 'https://forms.example.com/contact'

http_headers.description: Optional HTTP headers to include with the request. For JSON APIs, typically include Content-Type: application/json. For authentication, include Authorization header.

body.description: The request body data to send. For JSON APIs, provide a JSON string. For form data, provide URL-encoded string. Leave empty if no body is needed.
